defect.para: The vehicles involved are: AmTran RE and GENESIS buses built through October 18, 1996; Ward/AmTran Volunteer buses built February 24, 1988 through October 18, 1996; Ward Senator buses built January 5, 1990 through January 1, 1992; Ward Patriot buses built February 24, 1988 through December 31, 1990; Ward/AmTran Vanguard buses built February 24, 1988 through October 18, 1996; Ward President buses built January 5, 1989 through October 30, 1990.

American Transportation Corporation (AmTran) has determined that a defect relating to motor vehicle safety exists in some AmTran RE, GENESIS, Ward/AmTran Volunteer, Ward/AmTran Vanguard, Ward Senator, Ward Patriot and Ward President vehicles in connection with the emergency door hinges.

The buses contained in this recall have 2 (two) leaf type hinges per emergency door that consist of steel pins and/or lack zerk (grease) fittings. These hinges could bind from rust and/or corrosion. It has been determined that this could cause difficulty in opening the emergency door. This defect could cause entrapment of occupants in an emergency situation, which could result in personal injury or death.
Owners have been notified of this recall and have been directed to contact an AmTran Bus Body or AmTran Alliance dealer to make arrangements for inspection and remedy of the defect.

step1.para: Verify that the emergency door (doors if applicable) has 2 (two) leaf type hinges.
Check for the presence of a zerk fitting in each hinge.
Determine the material of the pin by scraping the surface at the end of the pin. Brass pins will have a gold color and steel pins will have a silver color.

Hinges with steel pins and/or those that lack zerk fittings require corrective action. Corrective action requires replacing the hinges. Please complete and return the "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #8 and writing in your UPS shipping address if not stated. Some buses involved in this recall have 2 (two) emergency doors. Please note this exception on the returned card.

note.para: If the unit inspected contains hinges with a brass pin and zerk fitting, no recall is required. Please complete and return the "AUTHORIZATION FOR RECALL SERVICE" card checking box #1.

svcproc.title: REPAIR
svcproc.para: Corrective action requires replacing the door hinges.

step1.para: With the door closed and the latch in the locked position, remove and replace one hinge at a time. This will hold the door in place while the service is being performed. To remove the hinges, remove the bolts retaining the hinges to the door and body. Install a new hinge by bolting the hinge to the body and the door.
Lubricate the hinges with Fleetrite EP2 Moly Grease or Equivalent NLGI #2 Multi-purpose Lithium Grease. Move door during lubrication, for better distribution of the grease.
Install Campaign Identification Label (see instructions below).
Complete and return the owners postage-paid "Recall - Repair Reply Card."

entry.para: Retrieval of unit, inspection and completion of documentation
Replace emergency door hinges (includes broken bolt replacement)

responuscan.para:
Proceed immediately to make necessary correction to units in inventory. As a precaution, you should not operate any of the vehicles subject to this recall campaign until they have been inspected for the presence of the nut assembled to the pinch bolt. In the event that the nut is missing, repairs must be made before the vehicle is driven. All inventory vehicles subject to this recall campaign must be corrected prior to sale, transfer or delivery.
If vehicles have been sold or transferred and you are in receipt of Customer Notification Letters and Authorization for Recall Service cards for those vehicles, transfer location or customer must be notified from your dealer location.

The National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act, as amended, provides that each vehicle that is subject to a vehicle recall campaign must be adequately repaired within a reasonable time after the owner has tendered it for repair. A failure to adequately repair within 60 days after a tender of a vehicle is prima facie evidence of failure to repair within a reasonable time. If the condition is not adequately repaired within 60 days, the owner may be entitled to replacement with an identical or reasonable equivalent vehicle at no charge, or to a refund of the purchase price less a reasonable allowance for depreciation.

In order to avoid having to replace an owner's vehicle or refund the purchase price, every effort must be made to promptly schedule an appointment with each owner to repair his or her vehicle as soon as possible.
